CONSTRUCTION SAFETY OFFICER

SUMMARY

Resourceful and extroverted safety professional with five plus years of hands on experience in safety coordination.
Expert in occupational safety and emergency management.
Well versed in handling employee compensation claims and supervising risk analysis.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERTISE Proficient in facility monitoring and implementation of OSHA employee safety guidelines Demonstrated ability to manage care operations, insurance underwriting and claim forwarding Expertise in filing, handling and processing employee claims Thorough knowledge of industrial hygiene standards Well familiar with OSHA regulatory authorities Adept at designing and implementing viable precautionary programs based on risk analysis Committed to establishment, implementation and promotion state approved occupational policies and guidelines

<JD_START>
Job Title: Safety Operations Specialist

Location: Belton, MO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Summary

Seeking a dedicated Safety Specialist in Belton, MO, to enhance our manufacturing plant's safety protocols. This role offers the chance to lead safety initiatives, ensuring a secure, compliant, and efficient work environment. Ideal for professionals passionate about workplace safety and continuous improvement.

Description

As an Engineering Project Manager, you will be at the forefront of operational transformation, utilizing the Operations Transformation Turnaround playbook. You will coordinate efforts across Operations, Maintenance, and Engineering, ensuring projects meet safety, budget, and compliance standards. This position requires a seasoned professional with a background in engineering and project management, ready to drive excellence and contribute to our site's long-term objectives.

Lead planning, organizing, and managing of large site turnarounds with a focus on safety and capability enhancement.Establish project schedules, including job lists and unit shutdown/startup plans, ensuring timely completion.Serve as the primary interface with internal and external customers, subcontractors, and vendors.Develop and monitor project metrics for schedule, budget, compliance, and quality adherence.Manage special projects aimed at site reliability and safety improvement.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a related field; Master's degree preferred with significant project management experience.Minimum of 10 years relevant manufacturing experience in an industrial setting; operations/maintenance engineering experience a plus.Demonstrated competency in MS Project or Primavera P6 and project analysis.Proven ability to deliver projects on time and on budget, with a strong analytical and technical communication skill set.

Benefits

Competitive salary range of $120,000 to $135,000 per year.Opportunities for professional growth and development within a leading manufacturing environment.Comprehensive benefits package, including health, dental, and vision insurance, and retirement savings plan.

Seeking a dedicated Safety Specialist in Belton, MO, to enhance our manufacturing plant's safety protocols. This role offers the chance to lead safety initiatives, ensuring a secure, compliant, and efficient work environment. Ideal for professionals passionate about workplace safety and continuous improvement.

Keyskills

Safety Compliance Training Process Improvement Incident Investigation

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
